Let's start with the positives, the console is amazing for the price and even though I was reluctant to spend money for PlayStation plus the cost want bad at all and you actually get a deal when you buy more consecutive months. Now on to the downsides. The box it came in felt a little flimsey as it was made of cardstock and not cardboard which I would have preferred as it was being shipped. The Amazon box it came in was cardboard so that kinda makes up for it. The hard drive slot cover is very thin cheap feeling plastic and feels as if it would break easily with little effort. The controllers 3.5 mm audio jack feels like it's in an odd place and I find myself bumping the cable I have plugged in the odd time although I don't know where else Sony would put it so I don't really have a good solution. Overall however, the PS4 is a great console and well worth the money. I originally bought the console as a stand in between computers as my old one recently stopped working. I intended to sell the console when I wanted to buy the new computer but having used it for about a month I've now decided I'm going to keep it. It's won over me and I think it will win over you too.
